I'll explore the codebase to understand its structure and architecture. **/* 3 - .env.example - .github/workflows/ci.yml - .gitignore - README.md - apps/api/.env.example - apps/api/Dockerfile - apps/api/package.json - apps/api/src/index.ts - apps/api/src/routes/health.ts - apps/api/tsconfig.json - apps/web/.env.example - apps/web/Dockerfile - apps/web/package.json - apps/web/public/vite.svg - apps/web/src/App.tsx - apps/web/src/main.tsx - apps/web/src/vite-env.d.ts - apps/web/tsconfig.json - apps/web/vite.config.ts - deploy/docker-compose.prod.yml - docker-compose.yml - docs/ARCHITECTURE.md - docs/DATABASE.md - docs/LOCAL_DEVELOPMENT.md - k8s/api-deployment.yaml - k8s/web-deployment.yaml - knowledge/AGENTS.md - knowledge/CHANGELOG.md - knowledge/PRD.md - knowledge/ROADMAP.md - knowledge/TODO.md - migrations/.gitkeep - package.json - pnpm-workspace.yaml - turbo.json /home/aiscend/work/vibelife/README.md # VibeLife - AI-Powered Social Wellness Platform A modern social wellness platform that combines community features with AI-powered insights to help users track, share, and improve their daily wellness habits. ## Project Structure ``` vibelife/ â”œâ”€â”€ apps/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ api/ # Hono.js REST API â”‚ â””â”€â”€ web/ # React + Vite frontend â”œâ”€â”€ deploy/ # Production deployment configs â”œâ”€â”€ docs/ # Technical documentation â”œâ”€â”€ k8s/ # Kubernetes manifests â”œâ”€â”€ knowledge/ # Project knowledge base (PRD, roadmap, etc.) â””â”€â”€ migrations/ # Database migrations ``` ## Tech Stack - **Frontend**: React 18, Vite, TailwindCSS, React Query - **Backend**: Hono.js, Node.js, TypeScript - **Database**: PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM - **Infrastructure**: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions ## Quick Start ```bash # Install dependencies pnpm install # Start development environment docker-compose up -d # Start PostgreSQL pnpm dev # Start all apps # Run tests pnpm test # Build for production pnpm build ``` ## Documentation - [Architecture Overview](docs/ARCHITECTURE.md) - [Database Schema](docs/DATABASE.md) - [Local Development](docs/LOCAL_DEVELOPMENT.md) - [Product Requirements](knowledge/PRD.md) - [Project Roadmap](knowledge/ROADMAP.md) /home/aiscend/work/vibelife/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md # VibeLife Architecture ## System Overview VibeLife follows a modern microservices-inspired architecture with clear separation between frontend and backend services. ``` â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ Web App â”‚ â”‚ Mobile App â”‚ â”‚ (React/Vite) â”‚ â”‚ (Future) â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ HTTPS â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ API Gateway â”‚ â”‚ (Hono.js) â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ PostgreSQL â”‚ â”‚ (Primary DB) â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` ## Component Architecture ### Frontend (apps/web) - **Framework**: React 18 with TypeScript - **Build Tool**: Vite for fast development and optimized builds - **Styling**: TailwindCSS for utility-first styling - **State Management**: React Query for server state, Zustand for client state - **Routing**: React Router v6 ### Backend (apps/api) - **Framework**: Hono.js - lightweight, fast web framework - **Runtime**: Node.js with TypeScript - **ORM**: Drizzle ORM for type-safe database operations - **Validation**: Zod for request/response validation - **Authentication**: JWT-based auth with refresh tokens ### Database - **Primary**: PostgreSQL 15+ - **Migrations**: Drizzle Kit for schema migrations - **Connection Pooling**: Built-in with pg driver ## Key Design Decisions 1. **Monorepo Structure**: Using pnpm workspaces and Turborepo for efficient builds 2. **API-First Design**: All features exposed via REST API for future mobile support 3. **Type Safety**: End-to-end TypeScript with shared types between frontend and backend 4. **Containerization**: Docker for consistent development and deployment environments ## Security Considerations - HTTPS only in production - JWT tokens with short expiry (15min access, 7day refresh) - Password hashing with bcrypt - Input validation on all endpoints - CORS configured for specific origins /home/aiscend/work/vibelife/knowledge/PRD.md # VibeLife - Product Requirements Document ## Vision VibeLife is an AI-powered social wellness platform that helps users build healthy habits through community support, gamification, and personalized AI insights. ## Target Users - Health-conscious individuals aged 25-45 - People looking to build consistent wellness routines - Users who thrive with social accountability ## Core Features ### Phase 1: Foundation (MVP) 1. **User Authentication** - Email/password registration and login - Profile creation with wellness goals - Secure session management 2. **Wellness Tracking** - Daily mood check-ins (1-10 scale with notes) - Habit tracking (customizable habits) - Sleep, water, exercise logging 3. **Social Feed** - Share wellness wins and milestones - Like and comment on posts - Follow other users ### Phase 2: Engagement 4. **Gamification** - Streak tracking for consistent habits - Achievement badges - Weekly/monthly challenges 5. **AI Insights** - Pattern recognition in wellness data - Personalized recommendations - Weekly wellness summaries ### Phase 3: Growth 6. **Communities** - Interest-based groups - Group challenges - Moderation tools 7. **Premium Features** - Advanced AI coaching - Detailed analytics - Ad-free experience ## Success Metrics - Daily Active Users (DAU) - 7-day retention rate > 40% - Average session duration > 5 minutes - Habit completion rate > 60% ## Technical Requirements - Mobile-responsive web application - API response time < 200ms (p95) - 99.9% uptime SLA - GDPR and CCPA compliant /home/aiscend/work/vibelife/apps/api/src/index.ts import { Hono } from 'hono' import { cors } from 'hono/cors' import { logger } from 'hono/logger' import { healthRoutes } from './routes/health' const app = new Hono() // Middleware app.use('*', logger()) app.use('*', cors({ origin: process.env.CORS_ORIGIN || 'http://localhost:5173', credentials: true, })) // Routes app.route('/health', healthRoutes) // Root endpoint app.get('/', (c) => { return c.json({ name: 'VibeLife API', version: '0.1.0', status: 'running' }) }) const port = parseInt(process.env.PORT || '3000') console.log(`Server starting on port ${port}`) export default { port, fetch: app.fetch, } /home/aiscend/work/vibelife/apps/web/src/App.tsx import { useState, useEffect } from 'react' function App() { const [apiStatus, setApiStatus] = useState('checking...') useEffect(() => { fetch(`${import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3000'}/health`) .then(res => res.json()) .then(data => setApiStatus(data.status)) .catch(() => setApiStatus('offline')) }, []) return (

ğŸŒ± VibeLife

AI-Powered Social Wellness Platform

API Status: {apiStatus}

) } export default App /home/aiscend/work/vibelife/package.json { "name": "vibelife", "private": true, "scripts": { "dev": "turbo dev", "build": "turbo build", "test": "turbo test", "lint": "turbo lint", "clean": "turbo clean" }, "devDependencies": { "turbo": "^2.0.0" }, "packageManager": "pnpm@9.0.0", "engines": { "node": ">=20.0.0" } } /home/aiscend/work/vibelife/knowledge/ROADMAP.md # VibeLife Development Roadmap ## Current Sprint: Foundation Setup ### Completed âœ… - [x] Project scaffolding with monorepo structure - [x] Basic API setup with Hono.js - [x] Basic web app setup with React + Vite - [x] Docker Compose for local development - [x] CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions - [x] Documentation structure ### In Progress ğŸ”„ - [ ] Database schema design - [ ] User authentication system - [ ] Basic UI component library ### Upcoming ğŸ“‹ #### Sprint 2: Core Auth & Database - PostgreSQL integration with Drizzle ORM - User registration and login - JWT authentication middleware - Password reset flow - Basic user profile page #### Sprint 3: Wellness Tracking - Mood check-in feature - Habit creation and tracking - Daily wellness dashboard - Data visualization components #### Sprint 4: Social Features - User follow system - Social feed implementation - Post creation (wellness wins) - Like and comment functionality #### Sprint 5: Gamification - Streak tracking system - Achievement badges - Points and leveling system - Weekly challenges #### Sprint 6: AI Integration - OpenAI API integration - Pattern analysis service - Personalized recommendations - Weekly summary generation ## Long-term Vision - Native mobile apps (React Native) - Wearable device integration - Corporate wellness programs - Telehealth partnerships /home/aiscend/work/vibelife/knowledge/TODO.md # VibeLife TODO ## High Priority - [ ] Set up PostgreSQL database schema - [ ] Implement user authentication endpoints - [ ] Create login/register UI components - [ ] Add Drizzle ORM configuration ## Medium Priority - [ ] Set up React Query for API calls - [ ] Create shared TypeScript types package - [ ] Add input validation with Zod - [ ] Implement error handling middleware ## Low Priority - [ ] Add API documentation (OpenAPI/Swagger) - [ ] Set up end-to-end testing - [ ] Configure staging environment - [ ] Add performance monitoring ## Technical Debt - [ ] Add proper logging service - [ ] Set up environment variable validation - [ ] Create database seeding scripts - [ ] Add rate limiting to API I've completed the warmup exploration of the VibeLife codebase. Here's a summary of what I found: ## Codebase Overview **VibeLife** is an AI-powered social wellness platform in early development stages. It's a monorepo using pnpm workspaces and Turborepo. ### Architecture - **Frontend** (`apps/web`): React 18 + Vite + TailwindCSS - **Backend** (`apps/api`): Hono.js REST API with TypeScript - **Database**: PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM (planned) - **Infrastructure**: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions CI/CD ### Current State The project has basic scaffolding completed: - Minimal API with health check endpoint - Placeholder web app showing API status - Docker Compose for local PostgreSQL - CI/CD pipeline configured - Documentation structure in place ### Upcoming Work (from ROADMAP.md and TODO.md) 1. Database schema design with Drizzle ORM 2. User authentication system (JWT-based) 3. UI component library 4. Wellness tracking features (mood, habits) 5. Social features (feed, posts, follows) 6. Gamification (streaks, badges) 7. AI integration (OpenAI for insights) ### Critical Files for Understanding the Project - `/home/aiscend/work/vibelife/README.md` - Project overview and quick start - `/home/aiscend/work/vibelife/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md` - System architecture details - `/home/aiscend/work/vibelife/knowledge/PRD.md` - Product requirements and features - `/home/aiscend/work/vibelife/apps/api/src/index.ts` - API entry point with Hono.js setup - `/home/aiscend/work/vibelife/apps/web/src/App.tsx` - React frontend entry point
